explanation: Price data not provided in artifacts; skipping 3-month forward performance backtest. To run the backtest, set PRICE_PATHS env with local CSV/Parquet files containing date, symbol, adjusted close (and open if available). This analysis constructs a 90-day net insider buying signal emphasizing open-market, direct-ownership purchases and penalizing sells, with recency weighting and cluster intensity based on distinct insiders. Signals are ranked cross-sectionally and saved. If local adjusted price data is supplied via PRICE_PATHS, the script runs a one-bar delayed long-short backtest with realistic frictions (commission, slippage, borrow), leverage and position limits, and reports Sharpe, PSR, bootstrap CI, hit rate, skew/kurtosis, turnover, exposures, and drawdowns. All tables and figures are saved under DATA_DIR, and no network resources are accessed.
